intro: Ebulum formosanum, commonly known as the Formosan ginseng, is a rare and endangered plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it thrives in cool, moist forest environments. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is critically endangered and protected in its native range.
